snippet: United Nations diplomats search for a plan for keeping the nation from becoming another Rwanda or Bosnia.
abstract: Memo From the United Nations; United Nations diplomats have avoided describing the carnage in the Central African Republic even as the word seems to be on the tip of their tongues; UN is struggling to prevent another catastrophe in the country, as crises elsewhere have made new demands on UN peacekeepers.

byline.contributor: Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Doha, Qatar.

lead_paragraph: United Nations diplomats search for a plan for keeping the nation from becoming another Rwanda or Bosnia.

headline.main: Stopping Bloodshed in the Central African Republic Amid Ghosts of Genocide
headline.print_headline: Halting Bloodshed Amid Ghosts of Rwanda and Bosnia

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
